business.headline: Tesla shares dip 45% in 3 months: What's behind the decline?Tesla's market value has fallen 45% since reaching a record high of $1.5 trillion on December 17, 2024. The stock surge followed Musk's financial backing of Donald Trump's election victory.

Income Tax Department expands e-Pay tax service to 30 banks. Check latest listIndia's Income Tax Department offers the E-Pay Tax service on the e-Filing portal, enabling individuals, businesses, and entities in India to pay direct taxes like advance tax, self-assessment tax, and TDS/TCS digitally from their bank accounts.

Sensex, Nifty early gains to close lower amid global headwinds; HUL gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 217.41 points to close at 74,115.17, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 92.20 points to end at 22,460.30.

Large caps vs midcaps vs small caps: Where should you invest now?Markets witnessed a brief respite after closing their best week in 2025 last week. Broader markets, especially midcap and smallcap stocks, performed well. The BSE Midcap index gained 3%, while the BSE Smallcap index jumped 6% last week.

7th Pay Commission: DA hike announcement this week, likely before HoliOver 12 million central government employees and retirees are likely to benefit from the said hike under the 7th Pay Commission. With this possible revision, the DA would increase from 53% to 55% of the basic pay.

These 4 PSU stocks could see strong upsideAccording to ICICI Securities, defence companies that already have supply agreements, partnerships, or orders from European firms are likely to benefit the most. SRK wins tax dispute case: What is foreign tax credit and how to claim it? Khan had declared an income of Rs 83.42 crore in his tax return, but the tax officer reassessed it as Rs 84.17 crore and denied him foreign tax credit (FTC) for taxes paid in the UK.

EPFO announces new rules for EDLI Scheme: 3 key death benefits updatesThe EDLI scheme is part of the Employees' Provident Fund (EPF) and acts as a social security benefit, offering financial assistance to the dependents of an EPF member in the event of the untimely death of the EPF member while still employed.

Why family offices are crucial to India's 'Viksit Bharat by 2047' dream?At the India Today Conclave 2025, Rishabh Shroff, Partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, discussed the growing role of family offices in India's journey towards becoming a developed economy by 2047. In a session titled "A Case for Tomorrow", moderated by Siddharth Zarabi, Shroff explained why family offices are vital for India's economic expansion and how they can contribute to achieving a Rs 30 trillion GDP target in the coming decades.

Pay is based on capability, not gender: Avarna Jain on pay gap in music industryAt the India Today Conclave 2025, Avarna Jain, Vice Chairperson of Saregama, spoke about the role of women in the workforce and addressed the long-debated issue of pay parity in the music and entertainment industry. She stated that in creative fields, women are leading the way, and pay is determined by ability and capability, not gender.

entertainment.headline: South Korean singer Wheesung found dead at 43Popular South Korean soloist Wheesung was found dead at his home on Monday. The authorities are still investigating the matter.

Meghan Markle's father criticises her show, mocks her for putting flowers on food Meghan Markle's estranged father, Thomas Markle, talked about her Netflix show, 'With Love, Meghan', in an interview. He called her 'fake', and mentioned that she should have had a more relatable show for women who are not privileged like her.

Badshah's weight-loss video stuns fans, internet thinks he looks like AP DhillonA recent video of Badshah has left fans stunned by his physical transformation. While promoting his new clothing brand, he showcased his new look, prompting fans to compare him to fellow Punjabi singer and rapper AP Dhillon.

When Life Gives You Tangerines review:  IU, Park Bo-gum's series is a must-watchReleased-Fri Mar 07, 2025In When Life Gives You Tangerines, IU and Park Bo-gum deliver mesmerising performances in a story that spans decades. Set against the backdrop of 1960s Jeju, this K-drama explores themes of love, endurance, and the quiet strength of women.

Actor Helly Shah on TV's future: We need to up our gameActor Helly Shah talks about her comedy debut, TV's regressive content, and her Bollywood aspirations. She also shares that she dreams of playing bold and tough roles.

Lollapalooza Day 2: Green Day, Louis Tomlinson, Aurora make thunderous India debutMumbai's Mahalaxmi Racecourse became the epicentre of music as Lollapalooza India 2025 wrapped up Day 2. From Green Day's electrifying debut to indie rock and soulful serenades, it was a night of musical magic.

Security sought for Rashmika Mandanna after MLA's 'teach her a lesson' remarkAn association seeking rights for natives of Karnataka's Coorg (Kodagu) region, Codava National Council, urged the state authorities to provide security for actor Rashmika Mandanna. According to the council, the actor was being unfairly targeted after Congress MLA Ravi Ganiga claimed she refused to attend a Kannada film industry event.

Shankar Mahadevan remembers 'guiding light' Zakir Hussain on birth anniversaryIt was legendary tabla maestro Zakir Hussain's 74th birth anniversary on Sunday. Marking the occasion, singer and composer Shankar Mahadevan honoured him with heartfelt birthday wishes on social media.

Lady Gaga recalls psychosis diagnosis and how she felt 'ashamed' to talk about itIn an interview, singer Lady Gaga discussed her personal struggles that kept her away from music. general news.headline: Flushed polythene bags, clothes blocked plumbing: Air India on plane toilet messAir India confirmed that its flight en route to Delhi was forced to return to the US's Chicago after their investigation team found out that polythene bags, rags, and clothes were flushed down the toilet, causing the toilets "to become unserviceable."

Didn't hit, but verbally abused me: Ranya Rao alleges harassment in DRI custodyKannada actor Ranya Rao, during her hearing, accused the DRI officials of verbally abusing her during interrogation. Rao was sent to DRI custody for three days by a Special Court, with the stipulation she be produced in court again on March 10.

There was no search warrant: Bhupesh Baghel calls ED raids 'BJP's vendetta'Former Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel on Monday said that the Enforcement Directorate (ED) raids on his residence earlier in the day were a "political vendetta" meant to "harass" the Opposition.

Designers apologise for Gulmarg show: Deeply regret hurt caused during RamzanDesigners Shivan and Narresh, who organised the outdoor fashion show in Jammu and Kashmir's Gulmarg during the holy month of Ramzan, which drew a massive controversy, have apologised for hosting the event.

Why Nepal is seeing a churn for Hindu monarchyThousands of people welcomed former king Gyanendra to Kathmandu amid a rise in calls to reinstate Hindu monarchy in Nepal. The Himalayan kingdom is seeing bike rallies and surge in online posts seeking a return to monarchy. This is what is fuelling these calls in Nepal, which was the last Hindu kingdom till 2008, when it became a secular republic.

Retirement not on mind, but Rohit Sharma uncertain about 2027 ODI World Cup goalIndia captain Rohit Sharma remained unclear about playing till the ODI World Cup 2027 following India's win in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Maharashtra's move for Hindu-only mutton shops with 'Malhar' certificationAnnouncing the initiative, the Maharashtra fisheries minister Nitesh Rane urged Hindus to not buy mutton from shops which don't have Malhar certification.

Caught on CCTV: Customers held at gunpoint, Rs 25 lakh robbery at Tanishq showroomA group of men carried out a daylight robbery at a Tanishq showroom in Bihar's Ara, holding the customers and staff at gunpoint and stealing jewellery worth Rs 25 lakh. Two robbers were later injured in a police encounter.

Why are US and Ukraine holding talks on ending war with Russia in Saudi Arabia?After a tense Trump-Zelenskyy clash in February, the US and Ukraine will hold talks in Saudi Arabia to discuss ending the war with Russia. What makes Jeddah the chosen venue?

Domestic flights from Navi Mumbai from April, third airport for Mumbai proposedMaharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar said that domestic flights will be operational from Navi Mumbai International Airport in April and proposed a third airport for Mumbai near Vadhvan port.

Sangam water at Maha Kumbh was fit for bathing, government tells ParliamentIn response to a question from Samajwadi Party MP Anand Bhadauria and Congress MP K Sudhakaran, Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav said that the water in the Ganga at Triveni Sangam in Prayagraj was fit for bathing during the recently concluded Maha Kumbh.

What Trudeau's successor Mark Carney saidMark Carney, a former Goldman Sachs executive, was on Sunday named Justin Trudeau's successor as the Prime Minister of Canada and leader of the ruling Liberal Party. Trudeau resigned in January, months after facing a stiff internal revolt with demands for him to step down.

She fled slavery, then risked capture 13 times to free others by a secret routeBorn under the shackles of slavery, Harriet Tubman refused to accept a life where she wasn't free. Even after escaping, she returned to the South 13 times to personally guide 70 other slaves to freedom via the Underground Railroad. Years later, she masterminded a military raid with unparalleled bravery and guided 700 slaves to freedom in the Combahee River Raid during the Civil War.

Rohit Sharma explains why he did not change template despite criticismIndia captain Rohit Sharma won the player of the match award in the final of the Champions Trophy. Speaking after the match, Rohit explained why he did not change his template despite huge criticism ahead of the tournament.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
